Items.Title: Boolean type bool
Items.Info: We already know a lot of conditional expressions that are extremely useful in programming. What they all have in common is that they can have two states be true and be false. Therefore, they are a Boolean data type bool.

Items.Title: Boolean type bool
Items.Info: Variables of type bool can take two values - true (true) false (false).

Items.Title: Logic constructs and code-style
Items.Info: A few coding guidelines for booleans and bool - Boolean variable names should be given as a question that can be answered with yes or no

Items.Title: Logic constructs and code-style
Items.Info: If you only return true or false in the if block and in the else block, then it is better to replace this whole construction with return.
